paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, to Jeduthun, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, to Jeduthun, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: Truly my soul waiteth upon God: from him cometh my salvation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Truly my soul waiteth upon God: from him cometh my salvation.

paragraphs.content: He only is my rock and my salvation; he is my defence; I shall not be greatly moved.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He only is my rock and my salvation; he is my defence; I shall not be greatly moved.

paragraphs.content: How long will ye imagine mischief against a man? ye shall be slain all of you: as a bowing wall shall ye be, and as a tottering fence.
paragraphs.contentHtml: How long will ye imagine mischief against a man? ye shall be slain all of you: as a bowing wall shall ye be, and as a tottering fence.

paragraphs.content: They only consult to cast him down from his excellency: they delight in lies: they bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They only consult to cast him down from his excellency: they delight in lies: they bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.

paragraphs.content: My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.

paragraphs.content: He only is my rock and my salvation: he is my defence; I shall not be moved.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He only is my rock and my salvation: he is my defence; I shall not be moved.

paragraphs.content: In God is my salvation and my glory: the rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In God is my salvation and my glory: the rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.

paragraphs.content: Trust in him at all times; ye people, pour out your heart before him: God is a refuge for us. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Trust in him at all times; ye people, pour out your heart before him: God is a refuge for us. Selah.

paragraphs.content: Surely men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie: to be laid in the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Surely men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie: to be laid in the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity.

paragraphs.content: Trust not in oppression, and become not vain in robbery: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Trust not in oppression, and become not vain in robbery: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.

paragraphs.content: God hath spoken once; twice have I heard this; that power belongeth unto God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: God hath spoken once; twice have I heard this; that power belongeth unto God.

paragraphs.content: Also unto thee, O Lord, belongeth mercy: for thou renderest to every man according to his work.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Also unto thee, O Lord, belongeth mercy: for thou renderest to every man according to his work.
